intro: Glandulifolia umbellata, commonly known as the glandular-leafed umbellate, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features glandular hairs on its leaves, which contribute to its unique scent and chemical properties. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale yellow, arranged in umbrella-like clusters. Glandulifolia umbellata is often found in moist, temperate regions and is valued for its medicinal and aromatic uses.
